text: this is Navid and i'm the only person
who ever walked across Pakistan alone
[Music]
this man is a warrior an adventure
junkie and an all-around awesome dude
who will leave you stunned when you hear
his stories a native of Karachi but
raised in New York Navid got a gig
making stories for the BBC but not the
kind of stories about butterflies and
rainbows sort of like helping
journalists cover hostile news coverage
so my job was to watch their backs while
they did their job a couple of years ago
there was a school massacre in Peshawar
at the Army Public School and my news
team was the first news team allowed
access into the auditorium so you know
without getting gory there was a lot of
bodies and blood and you know and still
like smoke hadn't even cleared up from
the attack and I think it was at that
point when I realized that I had seen
enough death and destruction and and
evil that I
I sent my resignation notice to my boss
in London and two months later I packed
up my bags my dog and we traveled up
north to humza rented a house and that
kind of changed my life I haven't looked
back what inspired him to start walking
[Music]
I saw an article on National Geographic
about a guy walking across the earth
that kind of inspired me and planted a
little bug in my brain dad kept like
gnawing at me for two years until I read
aside one day that I'm gonna walk across
at least Pakistan if not the world I
would like to at least walk across the
country so I started walking from the
China border which is at about 5600
meters and that was October 1st I walked
across the Karem highway and then I
continued walking through the Grand
Trunk Road to the syn highway all the
way to the Karachi port where you coming
from where did he sleep moth graveyards
police stations side of the road
anywhere I could sleep anywhere I could
pitch a tent I never had to worry about
food which I think you would agree
Pakistan you will never go hungry then
the following year Navid walked from the
Pakistan Afghanistan border to the Wagah
border of India in total he has walked
over 50 100 kilometres solo through
Pakistan Afghanistan and India while it
seems breathtaking walking solo isn't
always easy there were times when I just
sat down and cried there was a night I
remember it was like my second month
into my first solo walk where I was
sleeping in a in a graveyard and it was
like 1 o'clock in the morning I was
writing like an email to my daughter and
I just started bawling and the the the
priest came out and he was a he asked me
if I was okay and I couldn't even like
look at him so that was the biggest
challenge was being alone for so long
like humans they need company and we
need distractions now
Navid runs an adventure travel company
called Hansa on foot where he takes
people on tracks around the Hunza Valley
and beyond I just have a funny feeling
that he's not gonna stop living this
lifestyle anytime soon
[Music]
I'm sure been ski and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
